website_summaries.verdict: A unique boat navigation light meant for placement on the bow of a watercraft.
pros: Small LEDs last a long time before needing replacement
Suction mount makes it easy to place the light on smaller watercraft like kayaks and paddleboards
cons: The suction cup mount can come undone in rough waters and weather

customer_reviews.title: We rolled and sunk a hot rod boat on July ...
customer_reviews.text: We rolled and sunk a hot rod boat on July 3rd, 2016. The last I saw of my boat was this light disappearing into the darkness. Three months later, we got it back up from 35' of water. Put new batteries in, and it worked. I'm Ron Dunlap on Facebook. Boats on my profile pics, Just look in my pics and you'll see it in my hand, working.
customer_reviews.author: Deidra

customer_reviews.title: This light seems very well made. It is very ...
customer_reviews.text: This light seems very well made. It is very bright and durable. The suction cup seems sufficient. I will be purchasing a second one for my fathers boat. On the opposite side of the on/off button there is a black plastic circle which is removable, exposing a hole with a brass threaded insert for use as a second option for mounting using the suction cup. This is my reason for 5 stars. Most of the reviews I read complained about the suction cup, however nobody seemed to have noticed this other mounting option. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Allen.pulsifer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this bow light for my kayak. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bow light for my kayak. I did not want to drill any hole into my kayak. This light is of high quality, bright and comes with a lifetime guarantee.The suction cup mount is very strong. I ordered a second light for my sons kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Elton W.

customer_reviews.title: Marine stern light, mount anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I use these for low lighting settings on my rowing single scull. The rubber suction cups only last 2-3 years before cracking and losing ability to hold. The lights themselves are bright enough for this safety purpose. Batteries (alkaline) typically last 1/2 season and are easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Gorlin

customer_reviews.title: Tough little sucker
customer_reviews.text: This light is very nice for a kayak or small boat. It really sticks well, with no worry of it falling off. It stuck on to my kayak for several days without any problems in the garage. The light, which is what it's about is not very bright. It should be brighter, but hopefully, this means the batteries will last several days of light on. You can install it standing for more clearance but then it needs a reflective tape so its glare will not interfere with navigation. I will not know about durability but it looks well made and well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Atanacio Luna

customer_reviews.title: Not for use on watercraft >= 22'
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a backup navigation light for my 26' boat. The product's packaging reports that it is valid for use on watercraft less than 22'. Therefore, it doesn't legally satisfy the minimum navigation lighting regulations on my boat. Unfortunately, the Amazon product listing didn't report this important limitation.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary K

customer_reviews.title: Great for kayaking at night
customer_reviews.text: Great for kayaking at night. Stays put as long as you have a smooth surface to stick the suction cup to. I've been over some small dams with this thing on and it stayed where it was supposed to stay. Also has a loop that I ran some cord through to attach to my rigging just in case the suction cup fails, but it hasn't yet and I go night paddling once a week minimum.
customer_reviews.author: G Dubz

customer_reviews.title: Won't Stick for me....
customer_reviews.text: Sanded and cleaned my paddle board and no luck... loses suction fast and doesn't come with a strap but there is a small hole to attach to something because in my case I would lose it every few minutes if I actually ended up using it. Tested in garage several times not sure if others are having better look but its a fiberglass board I can't imagine why it wouldn't work.... bummer as I bought in January and now summer is here and can't return them, bought both the bow and stern light same issue
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: updated: suction cup deteriorated, too bright for dinghy use
customer_reviews.text: update: the suction cup deteriorated and basically glued itself to my dinghy. i have only used it a few times for a few days each. rest of the time it has been kept in a climate controlled location. what you see in the picture is the suction cup getting stuck to the dinghy after it was suctioned on for a few days. original: seems good but too bright for dinghy use... looking for a way to make it less bright so it does not ruin my night vision...
customer_reviews.author: Mystery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent navigation light!
customer_reviews.text: Great light for my SUP. Easy to mount and remove. I added a tether to it just Incase it loses suction, which it hasn’t yet.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Suctions well and not too bright.
customer_reviews.text: I also learned that if you tilt it just slightly counterclockwise, the green light is outside of your field of view, so you aren't blinded. Very happy. Would buy again. It would be nice if it included a lanyard for bungeeing (and the hole for this is super-small). I ended up threading a flash drive lanyard through the existing hole, then looping paracord through that and terminating it with a carabiner.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great - you can even move the suction cup to the side!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome light, well-made and the suction cup is just genius. I keep them indoors when they aren't being used. I hope the suction cup lasts longer than what others have said here. I'd been trying other systems that weren't LED, didn't have a suction cup and were a pain to mount, and weren't waterproof. This light has none of those problems. I learned only tonight from other comments that I can move the suction cup to the side. And to think I thought I new everything... LOL...
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great Light
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid light that sticks really well to your kayak.... I recommend it all the time. Not as bright as the LED ones that are cheap but uber bright and quit working eventually. If you want something that is gonna last this is the light. A solid well-built light made to last. If you want to stick out like a Christmas tree but want to keep replacing lights buy the cheap super bright ones.... I personally like to buy something once and have it there reliably working for me when I need it. I buy two and stick them to the front and back of my kayak when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: stacey perkins

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The O ring for the light cover is broke when I unscrewed to put in batteries. The little round disk won't stay in the back hole. A little disappointed falling apart before I even put it on my yak.sucshin cup won't stick to yak no matter where I put it. Don't wast your money
customer_reviews.author: todd emerick

customer_reviews.title: Will not stick to kayak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kayak as some of the other reviews said it works great. WTF! The suction cup is awful. No way will it stay put for longer than 10 seconds. I can’t rate the durability because I can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: 2+ Years and going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an emergency light for my hunting boat. Well long story short the bow running light died and it has been on my boat for 2+ years. Holding up great to wet, cold, and extremely hot conditions (stored in a barn that gets to 120 degrees in the summer). Never changed the batteries since the first purchase. I don't use the suction cup so I can't really review its quality. Probably works decently well on very slick surfaces like most suction cups.
customer_reviews.author: abirdsall1

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a better than decent product. Suction cup makes me wonder but so far, so good. I used about a 2”wide piece of gaff tape to put on section that pilot can see interfering with good night vision.
customer_reviews.author: Jak Knudsen

customer_reviews.title: Suction cup is weak
customer_reviews.text: I used once and it disappeared... I suctioned to the bow of the boat, ran up to drift the pass and no light it must have fallen off and I didn’t realize it. Good idea, poor execution. Might as well burnt a $20, would have lasted longer
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Stick & Go
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Stand Up Paddle Board for those early morning runs.... just stick ... turn on .... and Go!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get run over..!!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work good held on front of boat first time out. Hopefully battery life is good Had on for about 4 hours and still working..
customer_reviews.author: Rockdude

customer_reviews.title: Boat portable bow light
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bow light for my kayak for night fishing. The suction part does not work well with my kayak plastic. The light gets moisture inside which is not good for the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: John Carver

customer_reviews.title: lights for kayak with out having to put wholes in your kayak
customer_reviews.text: this is a great little light for kayaks if you dont want to do no drilling the light works great i only wish it came with recharge able battery that would be better
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Good product - reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our dinghy to provide visibility for anyone around us when out and about. Provides lighting and/or emergency lights.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, needs better way to secure.
customer_reviews.text: Light works fine, it's the suction cup that won't stay keeps coming off suction.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Chapa

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a temporary bow light until I repaired mine. This worked perfectly: long lasting battery power, bright light, and excellent design.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Great light! However
customer_reviews.text: Great light! However, as I don't trust suction cups on my kayak, I adapted this to fit to a Scotty track using the "niceEshop Black 1/4 Inch Tripod Mount Screw to Flash Hot Shoe Adapter for SLR Camera" (also from Amazon for $1.99). Keeps it secure if the watur turns rough.
customer_reviews.author: IrishCat317

customer_reviews.title: Part rusted - light quit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased January 2018 - by November 2018 a key component of the bulb retaining system had rusted so much the light would not work. Used in salt water environment. Hope I can get a refund, not sure I want a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: GRATE REPLACEMENt
customer_reviews.text: Replaced smaller existing nav light that had burn out bulb. Did not use suction cup use gorilla glue to attach it as per pix. Hold more firmly than suction cup. No need to worry about wiring problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E.

customer_reviews.title: Clearly Seen from a distance
customer_reviews.text: My boat light wiring needs work, no time right now to work on it, this light works perfectly for my need, the light will be clearly seen at light from afar distance
customer_reviews.author: George A. George

customer_reviews.title: For my kayak
customer_reviews.text: Great product, and good customer service and Fast delivery. Highly recommended Price was within budget The only thing I didn't like was my kayak surface was rough. This light need flat and smooth surface
customer_reviews.author: Omar Barakat

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This light looks great, but it’s just not bright enough in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Martin R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kayak
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had these long enough to talk about durability but everything else is on target.
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Mary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use on either had a wiring issue one ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for use on either had a wiring issue one of my boats. My jon boat had no light at all and my old 17' deck boat had a wiring issue that wasn't worth fixing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Info

customer_reviews.title: Suction won’t adhere to mercury 340 sport dinghy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a mercury 340 sport dinghy. Unfortunately, the suction won’t adhere to the surface of this particular dinghy. Will modify and hopefully can make is usable
customer_reviews.author: JMO

customer_reviews.title: Light good, suction bad
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and didn't expect it to stay "sucked" to the bow of my aluminum boat. Improvised a solution and it works fine and now I'm legal.
customer_reviews.author: Go Broncos

customer_reviews.title: Test it today
customer_reviews.text: I tried it today and it works great on my inflatable SUP - I took it out at the lake and it was raining and works great - I wish it would be more powerful light but it's ok for the price
customer_reviews.author: KYCat

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped promtly and I needed this for my Kayak for night paddling. I was entered in a BIG race and figured 55-60 hours to complete. The battery life is phenomenal (never had to change) Lit my kayak up for night time useage and Didn't blind me from back glow. LOVE IT !!!! PeAce
customer_reviews.author: CERNdog

customer_reviews.title: Portable Innovative lighting
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a portable bow light for my kayak. It's light weight and only takes 4aa batteries. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ika strip

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made poor design bad suction cup design Needs good Saftey line or it will be in the water
customer_reviews.text: Bad design needs a Saftey lanyard suction cup dosent stay applied to decking long pops off will wind up in the water very poor design
customer_reviews.author: charles russo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kayak, brighter than my real boat's light. Highly recommend, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: C J

customer_reviews.title: Great boat light.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our jon boat and it has been working great for several years now. good quality light !
customer_reviews.author: Frank Newman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my kayak for moonlight paddles and the occasional paddle back from drinking at my friend's cottage :-)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very bright!
customer_reviews.text: Very bright! The LED should work just fine and the batteries should last forever. Bought it to use on our dinghy.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: my boat is now legal on the water at night
customer_reviews.text: ok for your small boat. suction cup is not practical, as you want the light to stay put and not fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Dee B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my 17’ center console! The saltwater has corroded the one attached to the boat and I haven’t made time to work on it! I love that I can put this light in my bag and it’s there in case I need it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Night cats, here i come
customer_reviews.text: Looks great.just what i needed to get out at night. Will update after use.
customer_reviews.author: L Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great. I did away with the suction cup and just bolted it right to the front of my pontoon boat.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great little light for when you get stuck out after dark. Great suction cup. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Al G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replica of the old Aqua Signal unit that is no longer available. Works & fits well
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Dim
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright as I was hoping. May not be visible enough to meet coastguard requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: great for night fishing in a jon boat or
customer_reviews.text: The suction cup on this thing is strong. Mine has yet to slip off a motor when stuck directly to it. great for night fishing in a jon boat or kayak
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! love this light
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! love this light! great design, suction is phenomenal, trying it out tonight on kayak to see how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: This light was better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This light was better than expected. The LED lights are very bright and the suction cup is strong. I've been fishing with them 4 nights and have not replaced batteries yet. I would recommend anyone that needed this light to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: david hendrix

customer_reviews.title: A must for kayakers
customer_reviews.text: The suction cups adhere to the ends of my kayak and I can paddle around at night safely knowing I am visible. Note, I have to attach them and turn them on before I leave the shore, as I cannot reach them once I am inside the kayak. Fortunately, the four AA batteries power the lights for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: T&N Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. Appears to be good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my new inflatable boat and it produces a good port/starboard visibility. I used Velcro to fasten and a short lanyard, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install
customer_reviews.text: Loved that we didn't have to drill any holes works great!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Woodyard

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: The product failed in the first use. The seal is not water tight. Water got inside the light and ruined the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights for my Wife’s and I Paddle Boards they work great.
customer_reviews.author: guy m brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good suction, perfect size on our jet ski. Fits in the storage compartment easily.
customer_reviews.author: SabrinaCarol

customer_reviews.title: O-ring broke before even using it
customer_reviews.text: O-ring broke the first time I opened the light to install batteries. Disappointing as now it’s not waterproof. Rest of the light seems ok
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Prone to water damage and unable to attain replacement parts upon inquiry.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B Twist

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Works so well that we bought another on for our other boat as a back up to the built in unit on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Paduano

customer_reviews.title: lights work well and are bright at night.
customer_reviews.text: lights work well and are bright at night. only down side is its a little tricky getting the seal tight AND having the red/green on the correct side
customer_reviews.author: Thai Brand

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works very well and saved a lot of time from wiring a bow light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I received the stern light . I need the bow lights .
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bee

customer_reviews.title: It seems sturdy enough to last for a long time
customer_reviews.text: This item is so simple to use and remove when sailing in daylight. It seems sturdy enough to last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: John Fishburne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This light was great for the first month and a half then it stopped working just after the return period :(. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Wahoo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality light for the price. Very nice
customer_reviews.author: Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Received it today the product picture shows a permanent attachment ...
customer_reviews.text: Received it today the product picture shows a permanent attachment style with a pin which is what i wanted but i received a suction cut mounted one. Description of the item did state suction cup. The light bulb is LED but not as bright as I hoped. Will have to test it out on the water but not sure if i am gonna keep this product yet.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I used this when my bow light fuse ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I used this when my bow light fuse went out. one of those things that are a must for back up
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: Would definately recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with light. Works fine , is waterproof , sticks to hypalon great, easy to remove, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: The light works well and the suction cup is really strong! It even holds to my ridged bottomed inflatable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works but the suction cup won't stay on hull.
customer_reviews.text: Works but the suction cup won't stay on hull. Tried various things (water, gentle heat, experienced rowers) but we agreed mine were defective. The stern light worked better but both were not secure and eventually sunctioned off. Note the picture is not accurate. There is no lanyard and the base is just a very stiff suction cup. Better to use www.rowkraft.com lights that are USB, recharegeble, much brighter and STAY ON.
customer_reviews.author: Salmontree

customer_reviews.title: Need a new O ring!
customer_reviews.text: It seems sturdy enough but I opened it once to look it over & then when I opened it again the O ring tore.
customer_reviews.author: Suem724

product_meta.title: Innovative Lighting Portable LED Bow Light with Suction Cup
product_meta.description: Innovative Lighting is celebrating 25 years of engineering, manufacturing, and distributing LED lighting and custom injection molded products.
feature_bullets: Molded One Piece White Body Construction
Rated at 100,000 Hours LED Service Life

specifications.Cover Included: Innovative Lighting Inc. 560-1110-7 Led Bow Light White W/Suction
